title: London Fire Brigade
summary: The London Fire Brigade (LFB) is the fire and rescue service for London, the capital of the United Kingdom. It was formed by the Metropolitan Fire Brigade Act 1865, under the leadership of superintendent Eyre Massey Shaw. It has 5,992Â staff, including 5,096 operational firefighters and officers based at 102 fire stations (plus one river station).[1][5][4]
